sen.j: 忍海大国（おしうみのおおくに、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OSHIUMI no Okuni (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period.
OSHIUMI no Okuni (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period in Japan.
OSHIUMI no Okuni (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「おしぬみのおほくに」。
sen.e: Another way of reading his name in the old Japanese syllabary characters is 'OSHIUMI no Ohokuni'
Another reading of his name in the old Japanese syllabary characters is 'OSHIUMI no Ohokuni'
sen.cmt: reading his name よりもanother reading of his name のほうが自然だと思われます。
sen.e: Another reading of his name in the old Japanese syllabary characters is 'OSHIUMI no Ohokuni'
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Miyatsuko.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Miyatsuko.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Miyatsuko.

sen.j: 674年に対馬国の国司守として産銀を報じた。
sen.e: In 674, he reported that silver was yielded when he was in the position of Kokushi (a provincial governor) of Tsushima Province.
In 674, he reported that silver was yielded when he was in the position of Kokushi (a provincial governor) of Tsushima Province.
In 674, he reported that silver was yielded when he was in the position of Kokushi (a provincial governor) of Tsushima Province.
His official rank was Shokinge (the twelfth grade of twenty-six official ranks of Taiho Code).
sen.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E9%8C%A6%E4%B8%8B より、「冠位は」を追加しました。
sen.e: His official rank was Shokinge (the twelfth of twenty-six official ranks of Taiho Code).
sen.cmt: gradeは必要ないと思われます。
sen.e: His official rank was Shokinge (the twelfth of twenty-six official ranks of Taiho Code).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』天武天皇3年（674年）3月7日の条にのみ現れる。
sen.e: He was described only in the article of the Emperor Tenmu on March 7, 674 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
He was described only in the article of the Emperor Tenmu on March 7, 674 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
He was described only in the article of the Emperor Tenmu on March 7, 674 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: この日、対馬国司守の忍海造大国は、「銀が初めて当国から出たので貢上します」と知らせた。
sen.e: On that day, Kokushi of Tsushima Province, OSHIUMI no Miyatsuko Okuni reported, "Our Province yielded silver for the first time in Japan and we will offer it to the Imperial Court".
On that day, Kokushi of Tsushima Province, OSHIUMI no Miyatsuko Okuni reported, "Our Province yielded silver for the first time in Japan and we will offer it to the Imperial Court".
On that day, Kokushi of Tsushima Province, OSHIUMI no Miyatsuko Okuni reported, "Our Province yielded silver for the first time in Japan and we will offer it to the Imperial Court".

sen.j: 大国はこれによって小錦下の位を授かった。
sen.e: With this deed, he received the official rank of Shokinge.
With this deed, he received the official rank of Shokinge.
With this deed, he received the official rank of Shokinge.

sen.j: これは対馬のみならず日本における最初の銀鉱山発見であった。
sen.e: This was the first discovery of a silver mine not just in Tsushima but also in Japan.
This was the first discovery of a silver mine not just in Tsushima but in the entire Japan.
sen.cmt: not just in Tsuchima but also in Japan は構文的におかしい気がしたので、but in the entire Japanと後半を変更しました。
sen.e: This was the first discovery of a silver mine not just in Tsushima but in the entire Japan.

sen.j: 忍海大国について他の事績は知られない。
sen.e: Other things about him have remained unknown.
No other achievements of his are known.
sen.cmt: 事績は「定訳」にあるとおりachievementとしました。Other things ~ remained unknown よりもNo other ~ are knownのほうがプレーンでわかりやすいのではないかと思われます。
sen.e: No other achievements of his are known.
